channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-6875] Partially broken download pages
item.description:
The download pages have a box for choosing a mirror.

However this is broken - it does not contain a list of mirrors.
This is because the HTML pages are broken.

They should contain something like the following from

http://tomcat.apache.org/download-90.html

<form action="[location]" method="get" id="SelectMirror">
<p>
       Other mirrors: <select name="Preferred">
         [if-any http]
           [for http]<option value="[http]">[http]</option>[end]
         [end]
         [if-any ftp]
           [for ftp]<option value="[ftp]">[ftp]</option>[end]
         [end]
         [if-any backup]
           [for backup]<option value="[backup]">[backup] (backup)</option>[end]
           [end]
         </select><input type="submit" value="Change">
</p>
</form>

However they contain:

<form action="[location]" method="get" id="SelectMirror">Other mirrors: <select name="Preferred">
<!--[if-any http] [for http]--><option value="[http]">[http]</option>
<!--[end] [end]-->
<!--[if-any ftp] [for ftp]--><option value="[ftp]">[ftp]</option>
<!--[end] [end]-->
<!--[if-any backup] [for backup]--><option value="[backup]">[backup] (backup)</option>
<!--[end] [end]--></select> <input type="submit" value="Change">
</form>

The required templating code has been commented out, so does not work.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
AIUI, those .cgi/.html pages have been generated by a Derby build tool

trunk/java/build/org/apache/derbyBuild/ReleaseNotesTransformer.java

Indeed, that tool has the hard-coded boilerplate for the CGI scripts just
as you noted it, with XML comments surrounding all the square-bracketed stuff.

So, it seems like there are two parts to this issue:

1) We need to manually edit the 10.11/10.12 html pages for the older releases to remove
the XML comments so that the older releases return to picking up mirrors
successfully

2) We need to change ReleaseNotesTransformer.java to emit the generated
html page without the XML comments, so that future download pages will
be generated correctly.

It looks like our overall release documentation at http://wiki.apache.org/db-derby/ReleasePublication
is correct, although it seems to document all releases starting with 10.7 as
having a certain approach for their download pages, when in fact it appears
that there were 3 conventions that we used:

  • 10.6 and older releases used one technique
  • 10.7 through 10.10 used a different technique
  • 10.11 and 10.12 use yet a 3rd technique (paired .cgi/.html pages).

So perhaps there should be a third sub-task:

3) Revise the ReleasePublication documentation to be clearer. Nobody will
be producing any new releases of Derby 10.6 or earlier releases, and
probably not of 10.7 through 10.10 releases either, so we
can simplify the instructions by just describing the current release process.

I guess I still don't 100% understand the differences between the .cgi and .html approaches
to release publication. It appears that the Derby community switched from the *.html
approach to the *.cgi approach with Derby release 10.11, as described in DERBY-6588,
but the CGI generating tool was added by DERBY-4855 which long pre-dates Derby 10.11.

And the Instructions at http://wiki.apache.org/db-derby/ReleasePublication seem to
describe that the cgi approach was in place in the automated build tools since Derby
release 10.7, but Derby releases 10.7, 10.8, 10.9, and 10.10 don't use the CGI scripts
on derby_downloads.html; they use the html page instead.

I don't think I need to know these things to fix the broken pages on the site, but it
does trouble me that I can't pin-point exactly how this problem crept into our process.

Attached are three proposed patches:
1) tool.diff is the change to ReleaseNotesTransformer.java
2) xdocs.diff is the change to the Forrest source for the 10.11/10.12 release pages
3) site.diff is the change to the actual published release pages for 10.11 and 10.12

I'm not sure that we can really test any of the tool changes until
the next time we make a release, but the site changes should
fix the immediate problem for the 10.11 and 10.12 releases.

Rick, can you have a peek if you get a chance?

Thanks for picking up this issue, Bryan. I'm afraid that I can't explain the cgi magic because I really don't understand it myself. For the past 10 years I have simply been following a process which used to work.

There are two kinds of releases: mirrored releases and archived releases. Releases start out being mirrored and, after a year or two, are converted to being archived. For mirrored releases, the artifacts are automagically copied to lots of servers around the world. Clearly, mirroring is resource-intensive and the volunteer sites which host Apache releases need to garbage-collect stale artifacts eventually. So Apache wants us to only designate a few releases as mirrored. Typically, when we publish a new feature release, we then find the oldest mirrored release and we turn that old release into an archived release.

Both kinds of releases have html files which contain the detailed release notes. The two kinds of releases differ as follows:

o Mirrored releases have some extra cgi mumblings in the html file (the stuff that's wrong now and for which Sebb has proposed a correction). And they have a .cgi file which instructs the webserver to look inside the html file for those mumblings. The .cgi file never changes. It has exactly the same contents for every release.

o When the release manager changes a release from being mirrored to being archived, she first deletes the .cgi file. Then she edits the html file, replacing the cgi mumblings with hardcoded links to the archived location of the artifacts.

I'm not aware of any changes to this process or to the cgi magic. But I don't understand this cgi business, and my fingerprints are all over the release process by now. You can blame me.

This process goes back to the beginning of Derby. For what it's worth, I checked the subversion history of the 10.1.1.0 release page. Its original version (the version used when it was a mirrored release) has html comment markers around the cgi mumblings.

Your changes appear to do what Sebb wants.

+1

Thanks for the background, Rick; it's quite helpful. The distinction between mirrored
versus archived releases is clearer now, and our ReleasePublication wiki page makes
more sense as I read it in that context.

It seems that Infra have been tweaking their process somewhat, as some of the Infra
links in our ReleasePublication page now get 404's. (And some of the links on Infra's
own pages, e.g., http://www.apache.org/~henkp/ get 404's, too)

I think that, in addition to the changes I proposed above, we need a small adjustment
to Step "c. Remove mirroring for older releases which no longer require it." in
ReleasePublication, because we now have a bit more stuff in the *.html page which
we have to remove (formerly we could keep the mirroring section inside of comments
and it would simply disappear once we dropped the CGI part).

So I'll do a bit of housekeeping on the wiki page as an additional sub-task 4 as
part of following through on this patch. As part of that, I'll edit some of your contextual
notes from above into the wiki page(s).

Commit 1732682 from bryanpendleton in branch 'site/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1732682 ]

DERBY-6875: Mirror selection broken on Derby download pages.

This change removes the comment markers from the mirror selection
from the 10.11 and 10.12 download pages.

Note that these pages have already been (separately) committed to the
external build directory; this commit is just making the same change
to the page copies in the Forrest build tree.

Commit 1732683 from bryanpendleton in branch 'code/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1732683 ]

DERBY-6875: Mirror selection broken on Derby download pages.

This change changes the tool which generates the Derby download page for
a new release, to remove the comment markers from the mirror selection
portion of the page.

Thanks, Bryan. I have verified that the 10.12.1.1 and 10.11.1.1 download pages now let you pick a different mirror. There seem to be four mirrors available: primary and backup sites in the US and the EU.

All the identified tool and website changes have been made and verified,
and I've updated our release manager documentation pages on the
wiki with the revised release process information for mirroring and archiving.

Note: the number of primary mirrors depends on where the script thinks your IP address is located; it then displays the sites for that country.

You can change the country, e.g.

http://db.apache.org/derby/releases/release-10.12.1.1.cgi?cca2=us
[ Automatically closing all resolved issues that haven't been updated in more than six months. ]
